##

* Climate Change & Storms: Understanding connections between our changing climate & storminess through analysis of data

* All the course slides are available on GitHub {{< fa brands github >}}  <https://github.com/jelsner/CS-2023>

* Grades are determined by how well you do on the in-class exercises

* I expect you to read the notes, watch the videos, and run the code within the lesson slides. I expect you to complete and return the in-class exercises on time

## Hardware and software

* You will need a laptop computer running either {{< fa brands windows >}}, {{< fa brands apple >}}, or {{< fa brands linux >}}. I use a {{< fa brands apple >}}

* The class notes live on {{< fa brands github >}}. Updates will be available on _Canvas_

* Class notes are on slides made with an open-source scientific publishing system called _Quarto_

* Coding will be done in {{< fa brands r-project >}} through _RStudio_

## Do this 1st

Download the course slides from GitHub [{{< fa brands github >}}](https://github.com/jelsner/)

![](figures/GitHubLanding.png){width="2000"}

* Click on the link _jelsner/CCS-2023_

##

![](figures/GitHubCodePage.png){width="4000"}

* Select the green Code button then select _Download ZIP_

* Once the zip file is downloaded, expand (unzip) it

## Do this 2nd

Download and install Quarto by going to <https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/>[^1]

[^1]: Quarto lets you to weave together content (text, images, videos) and executable code into a finished presentation. To learn more about Quarto presentations see <https://quarto.org/docs/presentations/>

## Do this 3rd

Download and install {{< fa brands r-project >}} by going to <https://cloud.r-project.org/>

-   If you are using {{< fa brands windows >}}: Click on *Download R for Windows*, then click on *base*, then click on the *Download* link

-   If you are using a {{< fa brands apple >}}: Click on *Download R for (Mac) OS X*, then under *Latest release:* click on *R-X.X.X.pkg*, where R-X.X.X is the version number

For example, the latest version of {{< fa brands r-project >}} as of November 18, 2022 is R-4.2.2

## Do this 4th

Download and install RStudio desktop by going to <https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/> *Step 2:*

* Scroll down to find your computer's operating system and select the appropriate file to download

* Click on the downloaded file to install

## Generate the slides

* On your computer navigate to the folder {{< fa folder >}} called `CSS-2023-main`

* Click on the file called `CCS-2023.Rproj`

* Select the _Files_ tab (lower right panel) and select the `syllabus.qmd` file

* Click the `Render` button
